subject: Re: [Lupin-ish] akira, streamline, and Cam Clarke...
body:
> I forget his other alias, but his name is Cam
> Clarke, and he's also the 
> voice of Liquid Snake and the blue-haired guy in
> Xenogears.

Ah, the *perfect* opportunity to give out a juicy
tidbit about Cam Clarke I discovered the other day.

His other alias is "Jimmy Flinders." Back in 1974, he
was one of the lead actors in the original cast of the
Mormon/LDS member-written musical "Saturday's
Warrior." The name of his role? Jimmy Flinders. So he
kept it as a stage name. He uses it in the credits of
Robotech, where he played Max Sterling 10 years after
his role in the musical. So my question is....is Cam a
Mormon? Or is he just a friend of some members who
were looking at making a musical? Not that being a
Mormon is a *bad* thing, by any means.....

By the way, he has a nice singing voice. ;-)

If you care, you can find a copy of the 25th
Anniversary Original Cast recording CD lying arouind
somewhere.....usually at an LDS-based bookstore like
Deseret Book or Seagull Book and Tape. Maybe even at
Borders or Barnes and Noble....

Nah, didn't think you cared. Till next time!
